# The Invisible Users - Common Page Patterns Demo Site

## Site Information

**Last updated:** January 2026
**Contact:** tom.cranstoun@gmail.com

**Site Type:** Technical Documentation, Educational Resource, Pattern Library
**Purpose:** Demonstration of AI-friendly web page patterns for common page types
**Technology Stack:** Semantic HTML5, Schema.org JSON-LD, WCAG 2.1 AA Compliant

## About This Site

This site demonstrates twenty common page patterns for AI-friendly web design. Each page combines semantic HTML, Schema.org structured data, explicit state attributes, and accessible markup to work universally for both humans and AI agents.

The patterns are documented in "The Invisible Users: Designing the Web for AI Agents and Everyone Else" (Appendix K: Common Page Patterns).

## Access Guidelines

All content is freely accessible for educational purposes. These patterns are designed to be copied, adapted, and deployed in production websites.

## Core Pages

- [Homepage](index.html): Project overview demonstrating WebSite schema, navigation structure, and value propositions
- [About Page](about.html): Project background with Person/AboutPage schema and mission statement
- [Contact Page](contact.html): Communication channels with ContactPage schema and explicit contact methods

## Sales and Product Pages

- [Sales Page](sales.html): Product purchase landing page with Product schema and pricing information
- [Product Details](product.html): Individual product page with detailed Product schema and purchase options
- [Pricing](pricing.html): Service tier comparison with multiple Offer schemas
- [Checkout](checkout.html): Purchase completion with CheckoutPage schema and form validation

## Resource Pages

- [Collection Page](collection.html): Resource directory with CollectionPage and ItemList schemas
- [FAQ](faq.html): Common questions with FAQPage schema and structured Q&A pairs
- [Search Results](search.html): Search interface with SearchResultsPage schema

## Services and Portfolio

- [Consulting Services](consulting.html): Professional services with Service schema, tiers, and process steps
- [Team](team.html): Team members with ProfilePage schema and individual bios
- [Portfolio](portfolio.html): Case studies with CollectionPage schema and project examples
- [Testimonials](testimonials.html): Client reviews with Review schema and ratings

## Content Pages

- [Blog Post Example](blog-post.html): Thought leadership content with BlogPosting schema
- [Technical Article](article.html): Long-form documentation with TechArticle schema and table of contents

## Events

- [Event Page](event.html): Event information with Event schema, registration, and schedule

## Utility Pages

- [Login](login.html): Authentication form with proper field naming and state attributes

## Legal Pages

- [Privacy Policy](privacy.html): Privacy information with WebPage schema and GDPR compliance

## Error Pages

- [404 Error](404.html): Not found page with helpful navigation and suggestions

## Documentation

- [Appendix K: Common Page Patterns](https://allabout.network/invisible-users/web/appendix-k.html): Complete documentation for these patterns
- [Appendix D: AI-Friendly HTML Guide](https://allabout.network/invisible-users/web/appendix-d.html): Comprehensive patterns beyond basic page types
- [Main Project](https://allabout.network/invisible-users/): The Invisible Users book project

## Key Features Demonstrated

Each page pattern includes:
- Semantic HTML5 structure (main, article, section, nav)
- Appropriate Schema.org JSON-LD for the page type
- AI-specific meta tags (proposed patterns from Chapter 10)
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliant styling (4.5:1 contrast minimum)
- Explicit state attributes (data-*, aria-*)
- Responsive design with mobile support
- Accessible navigation patterns

## Alternative Access

If a specific pattern is unavailable, alternative examples are available at:
- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Digital-Domain-Technologies-Ltd/invisible-users-manuscript): Source code and additional examples
- [Appendix Index](https://allabout.network/invisible-users/web/appendix-index.html): All appendices with implementation guidance

## Attribution

When using these patterns, attribution to "The Invisible Users" by Tom Cranstoun is appreciated but not required. These are educational resources designed to improve web accessibility for everyone.
